item.title: Samhi Hotels bets on converting old office buildings into luxury hotels | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Samhi Hotels Pioneers Office-to-Hotel Conversion

Date: November, Source: Company Business News

Samhi Hotels Ltd has initiated a unique project in Hyderabad, converting an empty office building into a 170-175 room luxury hotel under the W Hotel brand, managed by Marriott International. This is the first-of-its-kind initiative in the country, aiming to launch by FY27.

Gurugram-based Samhi Hotels, led by Ashish Jakhanwala, is bucking the trend of new constructions by repurposing existing office spaces, expediting the hotel development process.

  1. The converted office building will be transformed into a luxury hotel in Hitech City, Hyderabad.
  2. The hotel will be operated under the W Hotel brand, managed by Marriott International.
  3. The project is expected to be launched by FY27.
Ashish Jakhanwala, chairman, managing director, and CEO of Samhi Hotels Ltd, claimed that this will be the first-ever initiative of converting an office building into a hotel in the country.

This innovative approach by Samhi Hotels could set a precedent for the hospitality industry, streamlining the hotel development process and potentially reducing costs.

item.title: From costlier cars, GST updates to US visa fees: What’s all changing from January 1, 2025? - Upstox
item.description:
Upcoming Changes in India: GST, Car Prices, Visas, and More from January 1, 2025

Date & Source: December 31, 2024, Economic Times

As the calendar turns to 2025, India is set to witness a range of changes in regulations and rules impacting businesses, consumers, and the economy. From higher car prices to stricter GST compliance, here's an overview of what's changing in the new year.

  • GST Compliance: Mandatory Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) will be required for accessing the GST portal, and E-Way Bill restrictions will be imposed to streamline logistics.
  • Car Prices: Major automakers are set to increase prices due to rising input costs and inflation.
  • Visa Processes: Thailand is expanding its e-visa system, and the US is introducing more flexible visa appointment rules and changes to the H-1B visa process.
  • Telecom Regulations: The government has updated Right of Way (RoW) rules to boost infrastructure development and simplify the process for telecom providers.
  • RBI Rules for Fixed Deposits: The Reserve Bank of India has introduced new guidelines for fixed deposits with NBFCs and HFCs, allowing premature withdrawals without interest for small deposits.
  • UPI Limit Extension: The transaction limit for UPI 123Pay users has been doubled, allowing feature phone users to make payments of up to ₹10,000 without an internet connection.

item.title: Stock market today: Sensex drops 450 points; Nifty50 ends below 23,650 amid global weakness - The Times of India
item.description:
Stock market today: Sensex drops 451 points; Nifty50 ends below 23,650 amid global weakness

Date: October 23, 2023
Source: Times of India

The Indian stock market faced significant losses today, with the Sensex dropping 451 points, closing below the key mark of 23,650. This decline was attributed to global market weakness.

  • The Sensex finished down 451 points, reflecting a broader trend of losses in Asia.
  • Nifty50 closed below 23,650.
  • The downturn aligns with falling international markets amidst economic concerns.
“The global cues were unfavorable, which negatively impacted investor sentiment in India,” a market analyst noted.

In conclusion, the Indian stock market is currently under pressure due to adverse global economic indicators, prompting caution among investors.

item.title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO opens tomorrow: GMP, price band, issue size among 10 key things to know | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO opens tomorrow: GMP, price band, issue size among 10 key things to know

Date: December 30, 2023

Source: Live Mint

Indo Farm Equipment's initial public offering (IPO) is set to open for public subscription on December 31 and will close on January 2. The company, which manufactures tractors and agricultural equipment, has a grey market premium (GMP) of ₹80 per share.

  • The IPO consists of a fresh issue of 86 lakh equity shares and an offer-for-sale of 35 lakh equity shares.
  • Price band is fixed at ₹204 to ₹215 per equity share.
  • The lot size for the IPO is 69 equity shares.
  • Proceeds will be used for debt repayment, expanding manufacturing capacity, and supporting its NBFC subsidiary.
  • The company aims to offer different portions of the net issue for various types of investors, with 50% to QIBs, 15% to NIIs, and 35% to retail investors.
“Indo Farm with traditional business value and experienced promoters is expected to capitalise over the long run,” said analysts at Anand Rathi.

The IPO is designed to strengthen the company's financial position and support future growth, making it a significant upcoming event in the stock market.

item.title: New Bajaj Pulsar Motorcycle Teased; Could Be The RS 400 - NDTV
item.description:
Bajaj Pulsar's New Teaser: RS 400 on the Horizon?

Published on: Date, Source: Source Name

Bajaj Auto recently released a teaser of a new Pulsar motorcycle, hinting at a performance-oriented model that could be an 'RS' variant. The audio clip suggests a single-cylinder engine, and it's speculated to be the 'RS 400', a supersport derivative of the NS400Z.

  1. The NS400Z has a 373 cc single-cylinder engine with 39.5 hp and 35 Nm of torque.
  2. The motorcycle comes with four ride modes and features like ride-by-wire, dual-channel ABS, and traction control.
  3. The new Pulsar, if it's the RS400, is expected to share similar power output and features, priced at a premium over the NS400Z.
  4. The reveal is anticipated at the Auto Expo in January 2025.
If it is the Pulsar RS400, then expect it to get similar power output and similar features as the NS400Z.

Stay tuned for more updates on this exciting development in the world of two-wheelers!

item.title: Ex-Infosys CFO Mohandas Pai Slams IndiGo Over Bengaluru Incident: ‘Left Without Air Conditioning’ - News18
item.description:
Ex-Infosys CFO Mohandas Pai Criticizes IndiGo Over Tarmac Incident

Date: December 30, 2024, Source: News18

Former Infosys CFO Mohandas Pai expressed frustration over IndiGo’s treatment of passengers after being left waiting on a hot tarmac in Bengaluru without air conditioning.

  • Pai criticized the airline on social media after the incident.
  • Passengers were left on the tarmac before air conditioning was activated following protests.
  • He tagged civil aviation authorities in his social media post.
  • IndiGo responded thanking him for his feedback and assured improvements.
“Indigo treats its passengers badly. Sitting in 6E 7407 without AC on hot tarmac in Bengaluru. No way to treat passengers.” — Mohandas Pai

This incident highlights ongoing concerns regarding passenger comfort and airline operations.

item.title: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu tells why he’s not worried about Indian talent migration, “Rising talent migration - The Times of India
item.description:
Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu on Indian Talent Migration: Not a Symptom of Hopelessness

Date & Source: January 25, 2025, Times of India

Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu has a different perspective on the rising talent migration from India. He believes it's not a sign of desperation, but rather an indication of the global demand for Indian talent and skills.

  1. Vembu sees the migration as a positive outcome of India's education system and the global recognition of Indian talent.
  2. He argues that the migration is not due to lack of opportunities in India but because better opportunities exist elsewhere.
  3. Vembu also notes that many migrants eventually return to India, bringing back valuable experience and investment.
"Rising talent migration from India is not a symptom of hopelessness, it is an indicator of the global demand for Indian talent and skills." - Sridhar Vembu

In conclusion, Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu's perspective on Indian talent migration challenges the common narrative, highlighting the global demand for Indian skills and the potential benefits of this migration.

item.title: Adani Enterprises to fully exit Adani Wilmar Ltd - The Economic Times
item.description:
Adani Enterprises to Fully Exit Adani Wilmar in $2 Billion Deal

Date & Source: Access Denied

item.title: Adani Enterprises to fully exit Adani Wilmar JV; check details here | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Adani Enterprises to Fully Exit Adani Wilmar Joint Venture

Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

Adani Enterprises has announced its decision to completely exit the consumer goods joint venture with Wilmar International, known as Adani Wilmar. The process will occur in two phases, starting with a substantial share acquisition by Wilmar.

  • Adani Enterprises holds a 44% stake in Adani Wilmar.
  • Wilmar will acquire 31.06% of equity shares from Adani Commodities at ₹305 per share.
  • Adani Enterprises will also sell an additional ~13% of shares to comply with public shareholding requirements.
  • Directors from Adani Enterprises will resign from Adani Wilmar's board.
  • Both companies will collaborate to rename Adani Wilmar ahead of transaction completion.
“Adani Enterprises, Adani Commodities LLP and Lence Pte Ltd have entered into an agreement… whereby Lence will acquire all the paid-up equity shares of Adani Wilmar held by ACL.”

Following the announcement, Adani Enterprises shares rose by 7.65%, while Adani Wilmar shares experienced volatility but ended nearly flat.

Adani Enterprises aims to reinvest generated funds into core operations including energy, transport, and logistics.

item.title: Govt starts countervailing duty probe on Vietnamese chemical | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
India Initiates Countervailing Duty Probe on Subsidized Vietnamese Chemical Imports

New Delhi, Dec 30 (PTI)

India has started a countervailing duty investigation into increased imports of Calcium Carbonate Filler Masterbatch, a chemical used in the plastic industry, from Vietnam. The move follows a complaint from domestic manufacturers who allege that the increased imports are subsidized, causing material injury to their businesses.

  • The Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR) has initiated the probe.
  • Domestic manufacturers have alleged that producers/exporters in Vietnam have received actionable subsidies from various levels of the Vietnamese government.
  • Countervailing duties are country-specific duties imposed to safeguard domestic industries against unfair trade subsidies.
"On the basis of the duly substantiated written application filed by the domestic industry...on the basis of the prima facie evidence submitted by the domestic industry, about the subsidization of the product...the authority, hereby, initiates an investigation."

Vietnam is a key trading partner of India, with exports and imports reaching USD 5.47 billion and USD 9.34 billion respectively in 2023-24.

item.title: Hero Xpulse 421 Flagship Adv Design Leaked, Launch Likely In 2025 - GaadiWaadi.com
item.description:
Hero Xpulse 421: Upcoming Adventure Bike with 421 cc Liquid-Cooled Engine

Date & Source: Published on 2024-12-12 by Gaadiwaadi.com

Hero MotoCorp is set to launch its flagship adventure touring motorcycle, the Xpulse 421, in 2025. The bike has been leaked through design patents, revealing a new design language and a 421 cc liquid-cooled engine. The Xpulse 421 is built for serious off-roading, with features like a tall windshield, radiator shrouds, bash plate, and a sculpted seat.

  • The Xpulse 421 will be powered by a 421 cc single-cylinder liquid-cooled engine, expected to deliver around 45 PS power and 45 Nm torque.
  • The engine will be paired with a six-speed gearbox and mounted on a trellis frame.
  • The bike will feature a ride-by-wire throttle system, all-LED lighting, a TFT instrument console, ride modes, switchable ABS, traction control, and a large fuel tank.
  • The suspension setup includes upside-down front forks and a monoshock at the rear, with braking handled by petal discs up front and standard discs at the rear.
  • The Xpulse 421 is expected to launch in India later next year, taking on rivals like the Royal Enfield Himalayan and the KTM 390 Adventure.

item.title: ITC Demerger: ITC Hotels To Have 100% Foreign Holding Limit Upon Listing - NDTV Profit
item.description:
ITC Hotels to Allow 100% Foreign Ownership After Demerger

Date: December 26, 2024

Source: Bloomberg Quint

The ITC Hotels demerger will allow foreign investors to hold a 100% stake upon listing, significantly changing the investment landscape for this sector.

  • ITC Ltd. currently has a 34% foreign holding cap, which will not apply to ITC Hotels Ltd.
  • The hotel sector is classified under 100% automatic route for Foreign Direct Investment (FDI).
  • The demerger takes effect on January 1, 2025.
"Foreign investors can hold up to 100% stake in ITC Hotels Ltd. upon listing."

This move is expected to attract more foreign investments in the Indian hospitality sector.

item.title: Suzlon Energy to get ₹173 crore income tax refund after ITAT rules in favour of company - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Suzlon Energy to Get ₹173 Crore Income Tax Refund

Published on: March 24, 2024 | Source: CNBC TV18

Suzlon Energy Ltd.'s shares recovered from their daily lows after the company announced it will receive an income tax refund worth ₹173 crore following a favorable judgement from the Income Tax Appellate Tribunal (ITAT).

  1. Suzlon was penalized ₹172.76 crore for disallowances, including claim of depreciation on goodwill for FY 2017.
  2. The company appealed to the ITAT and the penalty order was subsequently canceled.
  3. Suzlon's shares are currently trading at ₹62.92, down 0.5%, but have risen 63% YTD.
Consequent to the effect giving order passed by the Jurisdictional Assessing Officer (JAO) received by the company on December 29, the JAO has cancelled the aforesaid penalty order.

Suzlon Energy's shares have gained over 60% so far in 2024, despite having corrected from its recent peak of ₹86.

item.title: New Bajaj Pulsar teased! - BikeWale
item.description:
Bajaj Teases New Pulsar Model with Exhaust Note Video

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Bajaj Auto Official

Bajaj Auto has teased a new bike on its social media platforms, indicating a potential new Pulsar model with a focus on performance and technology.

  • Exhaust note teaser video shared on social media.
  • Sounds similar to a single-cylinder liquid-cooled engine.
  • Could be a new RS trim, possibly RS400 model.
  • Expected to feature a 373cc liquid-cooled engine with advanced features.
  • Potential specifications include LED lights, traction control, and multiple ride modes.
  • Set to include USD forks and dual-channel ABS.
“We expect an official announcement from the Pulsar maker in the next few weeks.”

This new model is anticipated to align with upcoming releases, and enthusiasts are eager for more details.

item.title: ‘Boss Called Me A**hole’: Intern, 21, Opens Up About Toxic Workplace In India - News18
item.description:
Intern Shares Experience of Toxic Workplace in India

Date: December 30, 2024

Source: News18

A 21-year-old intern recounted his troubling experiences with a toxic boss who frequently criticized him harshly. He shared a specific incident on Reddit where he was called an “a**hole” for a minor error.

  • The intern described the harsh treatment received from his boss, which included job threats and belittling comments.
  • He expressed uncertainty about whether to escalate the issue to higher management or to find another job while enduring the situation.
  • The intern's post highlighted the emotional toll workplace toxicity can take on new employees.
“To say I was shocked would be an understatement. I’m genuinely frustrated and this isn’t the first time.”

The attention this situation is receiving highlights broader issues of workplace culture in certain industries in India.

item.title: Maruti Dzire Crosses 30 Lakh Production Milestone Since Launch In 2008 - CarDekho
item.description:
Maruti Dzire Crosses 30 Lakh Production Milestone Since Launch In 2008

Date: [Date Not Provided] | Source: CarDekho.com

The Maruti Dzire has reached a significant production milestone of 30 lakh units since its launch in March 2008, making it the fourth model from Maruti to achieve this feat.

  • The Dzire took over 16 years to achieve this milestone.
  • Previously achieved milestones include 10 lakh in April 2015 and 20 lakh in June 2019.
  • The Dzire is the second-highest exported model by Maruti Suzuki in FY 2023-24.
  • Maruti has produced over 3 crore cars cumulatively as of April 2024.
“The Dzire took over 7 years to reach its first milestone of 10 lakh units.”

In conclusion, the Maruti Dzire's achievement highlights its popularity and the strong market presence of Maruti Suzuki in the automotive sector.

item.title: Jio Financial Services Share Price: A better stock for long term investment? Market expert Gaurang Shah answers - ET Now
item.description:
Jio Financial Services Share Price: A better stock for long term investment? Market expert Gaurang Shah answers

Updated Dec 30, 2024 by ET Now Digital

Gaurang Shah of Geojit Financial Services provided a positive long-term outlook for Jio Financial Services, emphasizing patience due to regulatory and operational timelines.

  • Shah encourages a 1.5 to 2-year investment horizon.
  • Investors should hold their shares and consider increasing investments at certain levels.
  • New investors are advised to start accumulating shares.
"We do have positive coverage on Jio Financial Services from a long term point of view... the contribution is likely to come in, over a longer period of time." - Gaurang Shah

Jio Financial Services reported a 3% increase in net profit for Q2 FY25, with total revenues growing but costs also rising significantly.

item.title: Tax department to tap Digi Yatra data to go after evaders - The New Indian Express
item.description:
Tax Department to Use Digi Yatra Data to Target Tax Evaders

Date & Source: Updated on: 30 Dec 2024, 6:58 am - Source: TNIE

Introduction: The Indian tax department plans to use data from the Digi Yatra app to identify and target individuals who evade taxes by not filing returns or underreporting their income.

  1. The tax department has accessed passenger data from the Digi Yatra app and is reconciling it with tax filings.
  2. Notices will be issued in 2025 based on the Digi Yatra data, with initial focus on non-filers and then those underreporting income.
  3. Frequent or high-value travel, particularly international trips, could trigger further scrutiny.
  4. Digi Yatra data is considered clean, reliable, and verifiable, making it a robust source for tax administration.
  5. Tax experts see potential in using such data for greater transparency and precision in tracking high-risk taxpayers.
  6. Digi Yatra maintains that it prioritizes data security and privacy, and it does not store personal data or share it with third parties.
“Data provided by Digi Yatra is inherently clean, reliable, and verifiable, making it a robust source for government use in tax administration.” - Source

Conclusion: The tax department's move to use Digi Yatra data for tax evasion could potentially boost tax compliance, but privacy concerns must be addressed.

item.title: 14 days, 37 transactions ...: How Cred lost Rs 12 crore in fraud from two accounts in Axis Bank - The Times of India
item.description:
14 days, 37 transactions ...: How Cred lost Rs 12 crore in fraud from two accounts in Axis Bank

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

An overview of how Cred sustained significant losses due to fraudulent activities across two accounts at Axis Bank, leading to a total loss of Rs 12 crore in just 14 days.

  • Fraudulent transactions occurred over a period of 14 days.
  • A total of 37 transactions were identified as part of the fraudulent activity.
  • The fraud led to a significant financial loss for Cred, amounting to Rs 12 crore.
  • Investigation into the fraud is ongoing to identify and prosecute the involved parties.

item.title: Vijay Kedia invests Rs 25 cr in THIS stock, earns Rs 10 cr profit in 21 days - ET Now
item.description:
Vijay Kedia's Rs 25 crore Investment in Greaves Cotton Nets Rs 10 crore Profit in 21 Days

Date & Source: Updated Dec 30, 2024 12:23 IST, ET NOW News

Introduction: Ace investor Vijay Kedia bought shares worth Rs 25 crore in Greaves Cotton via a block deal this month, earning a profit of Rs 10 crore within 21 days.

  1. Greaves Cotton shares have delivered a whopping 56% return in the past one month.
  2. Vijay Kedia bought 12,00,000 shares of Greaves Cotton on December 9.
  3. The rally in Greaves Cotton shares came after the company informed the exchanges about its electric vehicle (EV) arm's plans to launch an IPO.

The IPO includes a fresh issue of equity shares worth Rs 1,000 crore and an offer-for-sale of up to 18.93 crore equity shares by Greaves Cotton Limited and Abdul Latif Jameel Green Mobility Solutions DMCC.

Conclusion: Vijay Kedia's investment in Greaves Cotton has proven profitable, with the company's shares rising due to its electric vehicle arm's plans for an IPO.

item.title: Rs 9 Lakh Honda Sports Car Is Here! - MotorOctane
item.description:
Affordable Honda Sports Car: Buy a Used Honda Accord for Rs 9 Lakh

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: MotorOctane

The Honda Accord is now available for purchase at an accessible price of Rs 9 lakh, appealing to auto enthusiasts who previously found sports cars out of reach.

  • The 3.0-litre V6 engine produces 275 bhp and 339 Nm of torque.
  • A smaller 2.4-litre i-VTEC engine option is also available.
  • The car features a stylish blue-themed exterior with custom elements and adjustable air suspension.
  • Buying a used Honda Accord offers a chance to own a sports car below the cost of a new Honda Amaze.
Some owners have even driven the model for lakhs of kilometres, defying doubts about its reliability.

This model offers a unique opportunity for sports car fans looking for an affordable option, although prospective buyers should conduct thorough inspections and check documentation before making a purchase.
